entry.summary: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM AKDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Including the following areas, Deltana and Tanana Flats and Eastern Alaska Range. This includes the cities of Delta Junction, Fort Greely, Black Rapids, Donnelly Dome, Trims Dot Camp.

entry.summary: ...Flooding Possible on the Tanana River Starting Monday... Glacial rivers draining the Alaska Range such as the Tanana, Chisana, and Nabesna Rivers are running near bankfull. entry.title: High Surf Advisory issued July 10 at 9:30PM SST by NWS
entry.summary: ...A High Surf Advisory remains in effect... * SURF...Surfs of 10 to 12 feet will continue to impact south and east facing shores due to a large southerly swell and moderate to fresh tradewinds. * TIMING...through the new week. * IMPACTS...strong rip currents and large surfs.

entry.cap:areaDesc: Greater Lake Tahoe Area; Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties; Mono; Surprise Valley California

entry.title: Coastal Flood Advisory issued July 10 at 11:53PM PDT until July 12 at 12:00AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...KING TIDES WILL CAUSE MINOR COASTAL FLOODING AT LOW LYING SPOTS DURING HIGH TIDE MONDAY NIGHT... .The highest astronomical tides of the year, commonly referred to as the King Tides, will again impact the coast and bayshore Monday evening into Monday night and have historically resulted in the localized flooding of specific low lying areas each year.
entry.cap:areaDesc: North Bay Interior Valleys; San Francisco; San Francisco Bay Shoreline

entry.summary: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Lincoln, Vilas, Marathon and Oneida Counties this afternoon... At 122 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles northwest of Medford, moving southeast at 40 mph. Other strong thunderstorms were located over northwest Wisconsin and will move into central Wisconsin later this afternoon.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 11 at 1:15PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of south central Iron, east central Washburn, southern Ashland, northwestern Price and Sawyer Counties through 145 PM CDT... At 113 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Clam Lake, to near Hayward, moving east at 45 mph. At 110 PM CDT the Hayward Airport observation site
